snippet: The panel’s decision to end the criminal case in Mr. Garner’s death on Staten Island provoked protests, and the Justice Department said it would open a civil rights inquiry.
abstract: Staten Island grand jury votes not to indict police officer Daniel Pantaleo in death of Eric Garner; protesters across New York City take to streets; Justice Department announces that it will open civil rights inquiry; chart with photos of other fatal police encounters in New York City.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: The panel’s decision to end the criminal case in Mr. Garner’s death on Staten Island provoked protests, and the Justice Department said it would open a civil rights inquiry.

headline.main: Wave of Protests After Grand Jury Doesn’t Indict Officer in Eric Garner Chokehold Case
headline.print_headline: New York Officer Facing No Charges in Chokehold Case
